title: Valdemaras Martinkėnas
text:
Valdemaras Martinkėnas (10 March 1965 – 20 July 2004) was a <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet</a> and <a href="Lithuania">Lithuania</a>n professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er and coach.
Career.
Born in <a href="Alytus">Alytus</a>, Martinkėnas was the goalkeeper for the <a href="Lithuania%20national%20football%20team">Lithuanian national team</a> in the years after independence from the USSR, appearing in most of the qualifying games for the <a href="1994%20World%20Cup">1994 World Cup</a>. He won 19 caps for his country.
He also won the Lithuanian league championship with <a href="Zalgiris%20Vilnius">Zalgiris Vilnius</a> in 1991, and starred in <a href="Dynamo%20Kyiv">Dynamo Kyiv</a>'s 1992–93 Ukrainian league championship win. Later, he became goalkeeping coach to the <a href="Estonia%20national%20football%20team">Estonian national side</a>.
Martinkėnas died at the age of 39 in <a href="Nova%20Gorica">Nova Gorica</a> in <a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a>, drowning in a strong current after having gone for a swim in a mountain river. He was the goalkeeping coach of <a href="Flora%20Tallinn">Flora Tallinn</a> at the time, and was in Slovenia preparing for their <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">Champions League</a> qualifier against <a href="NK%20Gorica">NK Gorica</a>.
